marketNews.title: Weak US Labor Data, Rate Cut Expectations Strengthen
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics recorded that non-farm payrolls in the US rose by 73 thousand in July 2025, far below the consensus expectation of 110 thousand. The Bureau also significantly revised the non-farm payroll growth data for June 2025 from 147 thousand to only 14 thousand, and the May 2025 data from 144 thousand to 19 thousand. Both data revisions indicate that the labor market might be weakening faster than previously expected. Apart from the non-farm payroll data, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics also noted that the unemployment rate in the US slightly increased to 4.2% in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 4.1%), in line with consensus expectations. The labor force participation rate in the US dropped by -0.1 percentage point to 62.2% - marking the lowest level since November 2022 - while the employment-to-population ratio also fell by -0.1 percentage point to 59.6%, the weakest level since December 2021. Responding to the labor data release, market expectations for a US interest rate cut strengthened. Based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of the Fed cutting interest rates by 25 bps at the September 2025 meeting increased to 86% as of today, Monday (4/8), compared to 63% last week. Meanwhile, the probability of an interest rate cut of    â‰¥50 bps until the end of 2025 increased from 64% to 91% as of today. Furthermore, US President Donald Trump fired the Commissioner at the US Bureau of Labor Statistics, Erika McEntarfer, following the announcement of the US labor data on Friday (1/8). Trump accused McEntarfer of rigging the data, while Reuters reported that there was no evidence supporting Trump's claim. A Trump administration official told Reuters that the Trump administration was dissatisfied with inaccurate economic data - especially regarding the significant revisions to the June and May 2025 non-farm payroll data - as well as the declining response rate trend from respondents in the survey conducted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics since the pandemic era. Besides the employment data issue, surprising news came from Fed Governor Adriana Kugler, who decided to resign on Friday (1/8). Kugler's decision opens the opportunity for Trump to place a replacement candidate for Fed Chair Jerome Powell earlier within the central bank's board of governors. Previously, Trump was rumored to choose and announce Powell's replacement in September or October 2025, aimed at weakening Powell's position amid differing views on the direction of US interest rates.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Macro-economically, with the issue of the trade war and post-negotiation agreements having passed, we assess that investor attention will return to developments in interest rate cut expectations. Domestically, market participants will focus on government spending in 2H25. Investors also need to monitor the presidential speech next week, which may highlight priority programs for 2026. Meanwhile, 2Q25 economic growth data is scheduled for release on Tuesday (5/8).

marketNews.title: OPEC+ Agrees on Big Output Hike to Finish Unwinding Round of Cuts
marketNews.content: OPEC+ on Sunday (3/8) agreed to increase oil production by 547 thousand barrels per day in September 2025, continuing the series of production increases since April 2025 to regain market share. OPEC+ stated that this move was taken in light of a healthy economy and low inventories. This latest move by OPEC+ will complete the production recovery from the 2.2 million barrels per day voluntary cut made by 8 members in 2023. Alongside this production recovery, the United Arab Emirates received a gradual quota increase. OPEC+ still has another layer of voluntary production cuts of about ~1.66 million barrels and a production cut of 2 million barrels per day, scheduled to last until the end of 2026, respectively. OPEC+ will hold its next meeting on September 7, 2025.

BPS recorded that the value of Indonesian coal exports during 1H25 reached ~$12 billion (-21.1% YoY), with export volume falling to ~184.2 million tons (-6.33% YoY) and the average price dropping to ~$65 per ton (-15.9% YoY). 4. Palm oil stocks in Malaysia are expected to surge to 2.23 million tons in July 2025, according to a Bloomberg survey. This figure marks the highest level since December 2023, implying an increase of +9.9% MoM and +27.4% YoY compared to official data from the Malaysian Palm Oil Board in June 2025 and July 2024. Official data from the Malaysian Palm Oil Board itself will only be released on August 11, 2025. Head of Research at Sunvin Group, Anilkumar Bagani, told Bloomberg that Malaysian palm oil stocks are expected to increase in July 2025, driven by soaring production and declining consumption during that month. Bagani added that the Malaysian palm oil stock level above 2 million tons during the peak production season is unlikely to severely depress prices, considering that palm oil supply from Indonesia will be limited due to the B40 biodiesel mandate.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Shareholders Approve New Board of Directors
tickerNews.content: BMRI: Bank Mandiri shareholders on Monday (4/8) approved changes to the company's board of directors. Riduan - who previously served as executive vice president - was appointed as the new president director, replacing Darmawan Junaidi who had served since 2020. Meanwhile, the position of the new executive vice president of the company will be filled by Henry Panjaitan, who previously served as the director of guarantee business at PT Jaminan Kredit Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: ANTM signs $500 million credit facility from DBS Bank and others for general purposes
tickerNews.content: ANTM: Aneka Tambang announced it has signed a credit facility of up to US$500 million from DBS Bank Ltd., MUFG Bank, Ltd., Bank SMBC Indonesia (BTPN), Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, and United Overseas Bank Limited. This facility is intended to fund the company's general needs, including but not limited to capital expenditure, acquisitions, and working capital requirements.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Revises Net Profit and Revenue Growth Target to Over +5% YoY by end of 2025
tickerNews.content: SIDO: Kontan reported that Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul has revised its revenue and net profit growth target to over +5% YoY by the end of 2025, lower than the management's initial target which aimed for revenue and net profit growth of +10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DAAZ to boost expansion plans by acquiring 10 vessels worth ~$32.6 million
tickerNews.content: DAAZ: Erlyn Sulistio, Director of Daaz Bara Lestari, stated that the company has signed a purchase agreement for 10 vessels worth approximately US$32.6 million or IDR 530.7 billion, intended to support its subsidiaries' operations in the trade and sea transportation sectors. the vessels purchased consist of 3 sets of tugboats and barges with a capacity of 10,500 MT, 2 oil tankers with a capacity of 6,200 MT, and 2 oil barges with a capacity of 4,900 MT.
